inputs.value: Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) SSL policy is not the latest Amazon predefined SSL policy or is a custom ELB SSL policy.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Always use the current AWS predefined security policy.
inputs.name: suggested_action

outputs.name: report

inputs.value: There is an IAM group defined without any users in it and therefore unused.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Ensure that groups defined within IAM have active users in them. If the groups don't have active users or are not being used, delete the unused IAM group.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: User has inactive keys that have not been rotated in the last 90 days.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: If you regularly use the AWS access keys, we recommend that you also regularly rotate or delete them.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: User has active keys that have not been rotated in the last 90 days
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: If you regularly use the AWS access keys, we recommend that you also regularly rotate or delete them.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: There currently isn't a password policy to require a certain password length, password expiration, prevent password reuse, and more.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Configure a strong password policy for your users to ensure that passwords expire, aren't reused, have a certain length, require certain characters, and more.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: The current password policy doesn't prevent users from reusing thier old passwords.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Configure a strong password policy for your users to ensure that passwords expire, aren't reused, have a certain length, require certain characters, and more.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: The current password policy doesn't require users to regularly change their passwords. User passwords are set to never expire.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Configure a strong password policy for your users so that passwords expire such that users must change their passwords periodically.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: Cloud user does not have Multi-Factor Authentication enabled on their cloud account.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication for every cloud user.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: Root cloud user does not have Multi-Factor Authentication enabled on their cloud account
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication for the root cloud user.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: Root user has an access key that is active.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Replace the root access key with an IAM user access key, and then disable and remove the root access key.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: The root user has been logging in using a password.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Re-set your root account password, don't log in to your root account, and secure root account password in a safe place.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: User account is using custom inline policies versus using IAM group managed policies.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Switch all inline policies to apply to IAM groups and assign users IAMs roles.
inputs.name: suggested_action
